javadoc:
An instance of a DataType that is applicable for a given context.  Most
 dataTypes are not context sensitive and are suitable for use anywhere.
 Others like dynamic structures need to create an instance that wraps the
 data type.
 
 It helps for situations where a data type must have a length.

methods.name: <init>
methods.comment: Create an instance of a data type with the given length.

params.name: length
params.comment: fixed length of the data type

methods.javadoc: @return the fixed length of the data type
methods.name: getLength

return.comment: the fixed length of the data type

methods.javadoc: Set the length of this data type instance
methods.name: setLength
methods.comment: Set the length of this data type instance

methods.name: getDataTypeInstance
methods.comment:
Generate a data-type instance
 Factory and Dynamic data-types are NOT handled.

return.comment: data-type instance or null if one could not be determined

methods.name: getDataTypeInstance
methods.comment:
Attempt to create a fixed-length data-type instance.
 Factory and non-sizable Dynamic data-types are NOT handled.

params.name: length
params.comment: length for sizable Dynamic data-types, otherwise ignored

return.comment: data-type instance or null if unable to create instance.

methods.name: getDataTypeInstance
methods.comment:
Attempt to create a data-type instance associated with a specific memory location.
 Factory and Dynamic data-types are handled.

params.name: length
params.comment: length for sizable Dynamic data-types, otherwise ignored

return.comment: data-type instance or null if unable to create instance.

name: DataTypeInstance
comment:
An instance of a DataType that is applicable for a given context.  Most
 dataTypes are not context sensitive and are suitable for use anywhere.
 Others like dynamic structures need to create an instance that wraps the
 data type.
 
 It helps for situations where a data type must have a length.
